explains: adj. <正式>潜伏的，隐袭的；阴险的，狡猾的

sentences.en: The changes are insidious, and will not produce a noticeable effect for 15 to 20 years.
sentences.cn: 变化是悄然发生的，15到20年间不会产生明显效果。

sentences.en: But he's also found a kind of insidious prejudice.
sentences.cn: 但他也发现了一种潜在的偏见。

sentences.en: This loss of culture memory, as insidious as Alzheimer's disease, eats away at the soul of the nation, says Bertman, author of Hyperculuture.
sentences.cn: 《过度文化》一书的作者伯特曼（Bertman）说，文化记忆的丧失就像阿尔茨海默症一样潜伏，侵蚀着这个国家的灵魂。
